text: 'the maine senator said senate start scratch bill sen susan collins r maine said senate come new fresh approach health care rather rigidly follow obamacare replacement bill narrowly passed house thursday senate starting scratch collins told abc news chief anchor george stephanopoulos exclusive interview sunday week going draft bill convinced going take time right said house speaker paul ryan also appeared week acknowledged senate would make changes bill collins said thinks upper chamber come whole new fresh approach solves legitimate flaws exist affordable care act keep benefits aca collins expressed concerns house bill maine senator said unlikely people pre existing medical conditions would get better coverage house bill obamacare legislation would give states freedom aspects insurance coverage much discretion given states without guardrails collins said coverage offered bill unaffordable good child juvenile diabetes said collins also took issue bill failure adjust size tax credits based peoples income live really hurts state like maine older population living largely expensive rural areas far health care concerned said senator said also opposes bills ban medicaid funding planned parenthood think low income women denied choice health care providers family planning cancer screenings well women care collins said fair mistake defund planned parenthood senate single woman part working group created overhaul health care stephanopoulos asked collins one five republican female senators included group well leaders obviously chose people want said collins added would like bipartisan group senators take health care including democrats acknowledge problems obamacare republicans also want make sure reducing coverage giving flexibility '
